history.content: <md>For the issue of double majoring, please contact your assigned BioE ESS Advisor for guidance and eligibility requirements.  In my experience, it’s often much easier to explain to a student through an appointment than by email given the multiple eligibility requirements. </md>

children.subject:
Anonymous wrote:

Do I enroll for waitlist for these classes because I'm BioE?

It seems to me that this is implying that you think there are two systems for enrolling in classes and is somehow different than BioE classes. All classes use the same system, with the only difference being reserved seats, which are declared on classes.berkeley.edu. The way it works is if you checked the right box, you'll enroll into the class if you have there's room for you and put onto the waitlist if you don't. Always check the box that says put on waitlist if class is full.

history.content:
I'm not sure how eecs class enrollment or major declaration works in CoE, I entered as BioE but I want to double major with EECS or CS. I am taking 61BL over the summer and want to do C in the fall and other EE classes later on. Do I enroll for waitlist for these classes because I'm BioE? I tried enrolling normally but I think I'm not EECS or CS and am not allowed to enroll.

For the issue of double majoring, how would I declare the second major in the future? Do I just need to take the right classes for the additional major until I meet the prerequisites? Or is there some application? I skimmed through the CoE website on double majoring a few weeks back and I'll reread it in depth after finals, but if anyone has gone through this scenario your experiences would be appreciated :)
history.subject: CoE BioE Rising Sophomore Trying to get CS61C, Questions on Double Majoring
